intro: Hieracium cisuralense, commonly known as the Transural Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium cisuralense is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
